    Team News

    Manchester City
    • Manuel Pellegrini has confirmed Yaya Toure is out for this match following the knock he picked up at the end of their 4-0 win over Stoke on Saturday.
    • Bacary Sagna has spent most of the season as Manuel Pellegrini's first choice right-back, but he has missed their last two matches because of injury. Pablo Zabaleta could continue at right-back as a result.
    Real Madrid
    • Karim Benzema has been a swift recovery after limping off with injury in the first-half of Real Madrid's 3-2 win over Rayo Vallecano at the weekend.
    • Cristiano Ronaldo missed his first league game of the season at the weekend with a groin strain but is expected to return to the squad here.
    • Casemiro missed the win over Rayo through suspension but will return in midweek. Luka Modric was given the weekend off and will also be selected on Tuesday.
    • Dani Carvajal is an injury doubt but will play at right-back over Danilo if he recovers in time.

    Prediction

    • Manchester City warmed up for their first ever Champions League semi-final clash with a routine 4-0 win over Stoke at the weekend. Manuel Pellegrini's side have hit good form just at the right time and are unbeaten in their last seven in all competitions. Their only defeats in Europe this season both came against Juventus in the group stages.
    • The Premier League outfit have only kept three clean sheets in their 19 Champions League home matches, although two of those have come in their last two matches at the Etihad. Both teams have scored in 14 of those matches.
    • Real Madrid overcame a scare to beat league minnows Rayo Vallecano at the weekend. Gareth Bale was the star of the show on that occasion and Zinedine Zidane's side should be bolstered by the expected return of Cristiano Ronaldo, who is the top goalscorer in the competition this season (16). Madrid have won five on the bounce since losing 2-0 to Wolfsburg in the last round. Their away performances haven't been as good as their ones at home this season and City have to take advantage of that to stand any chance of reaching the final.
    Prediction:
    Manchester City
    2
    2
    Real Madrid

    • [ - ] Turan - member since 22-Nov-13

      1/2 For Real Madrid, i believe that Navas and Casemiro have given this team the much needed stability they lacked for some time. In goal Navas gives the defenders confidence. Ramos and Pepe are two of the best center backs out there and are really good defending and attacking set-pieces, crossing the ball and especially Ramos is good at carrying the ball forward fast and passing it directly to oppositions half. Casemiro is doing the job once Makelele did, simple efficient and quiet. He is strong in the air, goes hard into challenges, intercepts well and is relatively good at passing and crossing. The mopping Casemiro does at the back allows Modric and Kroos to do what they are best at, regulating the tempo, changing directions fast, crossing, playing directly, taking set pieces and always giving other players options to pass the ball to. The trio of Casemiro,Modric and Kroos will likely decide which team has most of the posession.

    • [ - ] Castle - member since 08-Sep-15

      @asinko Their defense has been a bit mess every now and then this season since their leader Kompany has spent lot of time injured and his match fitness is a big question if he'll even play. Sagna and Clichy will most likely start as their City's most consistent and defensively sound full backs. Otamendi makes lots of brave and flashy tackles but haven't been really consistent. But Mangala is their weak link, he often plays himself out trying to win the ball too aggressively and commits fouls more easily. Their defense needs to be well organized and have all possible support from midfield. But I doubt they'd still be able to defend flawlessly against Real for two matches or even 90 mins. I'm convinced City will concede in both games, they just have to keep it at minimum and try to outscore Real. Good luck with that.

Barca, on the other hand, have played top, difficult (usually the most difficult available team) team 12 of the last 14 round of 8 and round of 16 games. Look it up if you don't believe me.
